pnp:CanvasControlProperty.Value:
Microsoft Teams everywhere

Use Microsoft Teams on your desktop, the web, or your iOS or Android mobile..


The feature to raise your hand is now in Teams!

Microsoft Teams

Microsoft Teams is the hub for teamwork in Microsoft 365 that brings together people in a shared workspace where you can chat, meet, collaborate on files and automate workflows.

Use Teams for chat and collaboration, and the real value comes when you use the entire set of features to do more with teams.

This site contains resources such as:

  • Read more about Teams
  • Learn more about data management
  • information policies in Teams
  • Get tips and tricks with the help of Teams
    Get help!

pnp:CanvasControlProperty.Value:
What are Microsoft Teams and why should I use it?

Microsoft Teams is a messaging app for teams where all conversations, meetings, files and notes can be accessed by everyone, all in one place. It is a place for collaboration and work that takes place outdoors. The Microsoft Team interface is reminiscent of chat clients on social media, such as Facebook or Google Hangouts.

What is a Channel in Teams?

Channels are fantastic because they allow teammates to have focused conversations on specific topics. Each team has their own set of channels (starting with the general channel), and the members of that team can decide what they want the rest of their channels to focus on. Some channels are devoted to specific projects, initiatives and locations. Some are for different areas of interest, updates or discussion topics. Some channels are just for fun! Each channel belonging to a team is completely public to all group members, so everyone can feel free to join a channel call.

pnp:CanvasControlProperty.Value: This is an organization-specific page. Choose your own content and style to decorate this page. This is just for suggesting such a site.

What are Microsoft Teams and why should I use it?


Microsoft Teams is a messaging app for teams where all conversations, meetings, files and notes can be accessed by everyone, all in one place. It is a place for collaboration and work that takes place outdoors. The Microsoft Team interface is reminiscent of chat clients on social media, such as Facebook or Google Hangouts.

What is a channel?


Analogs are fantastic because they allow teammates to have focused conversations on specific topics. Each team has their own set of channels (starting with the general channel), and the members of that team can decide what they want the rest of their channels to focus on. Some channels are devoted to specific projects, initiatives and locations. Some are for different areas of interest, updates or discussion topics. Some channels are just for fun! Each channel belonging to a team is completely public to all group members, so everyone can feel free to join a channel call.
